column4: Why does my cursor move faster left/right than up/down when I use my touchpad?  It seems to be in relation to my screen resolution and is not the same for a normal USB mouse.
what make / model is the laptop?
try turning off tap to click, may help
also can you pastebin the output of:  lsmod
it may affect it, its a quick thing to test
ok cool, can you run: lsmod    and give the output
http://pastebin.com/uSRfatT7
try:   options psmouse proto=imps    or     options psmouse proto=bare       in /etc/modprobe.d/psmouse.conf
you can then run: sudo modprobe -r psmouse; sudo modprobe psmouse
try them individually :)
you won't you make the file
those files add extra options to the modules when you load them
some weird hardware needs extra options to work nice
run: sudo modprobe -r psmouse; sudo modprobe psmouse
if it doesn't work, re-edit the file and retry the other option I gave (delete the old text first)
so the option you used was necessary for your hadware
look for other options you can add to the module, one may make it nice
you may also be able to simply increase the mouse speed in the mouse settings to make up for the slowness
Do you have a list of options for psmouse?
i just websearched and found those, the proto=imps one is good for sony viaos I have noticed
Do you know where I can find some information on /etc/modprobe.d/psmouse.conf?
it's not the filename you need to worry about. You can call it ANYTHING you want, as long as it ends in .conf
look for options on the psmouse module
What were those two commands again?
